constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential
A4D Class E to residential - District and Local Town centres

description: Variation of conditions 2 (Approved drawings), 5 (Revised Energy Statement), 6 (Air permeability) and 7 (PV Panel installation) attached to planning permission 2022/1941 dated 01/06/2023. Effect of alterations include amendments to plant strategy, including addition of additional plant, replacement of orangeries with pergolas, changes to window strategy, temporary enabling works.
decision_conditions: <p>The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development shall at all times remain 5dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window or other sensitive receptor if appropriate (add/delete as appropriate)</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.</p>

<p>Within 6 months of commencement of the development hereby approved, the BREEAM Interim Design Certificate shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, providing full details to demonstrate at least the following standards have been met, as set out in the hereby approved BREEAM pre-assessment (dated November 2022, prepared by Verte) - targeted credits must be presented in a tracker comparing credits targeted at BREEAM pre-assessment stage:</p><p>(a)Minimum BREEAM Rating of Excellent</p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p>Within 6 months of occupation of the development, the BREEAM Final Design Certificate confirming an ‘Excellent Rating’ shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, providing full details confirming the final rating and credits have been achieved or improved upon the pre-commencement figures - achieved credits must be presented in a tracker comparing credits achieved at BREEAM Interim Certification stage.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction.</p>

<p>Full details of the location of the condenser units from Air Source Heat Pumps (ASHP) (or any other related fixed plant adopted), shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, in writing prior to the installation of the relevant parts to demonstrate at least the following standards been achieved or improved upon as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (prepared by Verte dated July 2022). The ASHP thereby approved shall be installed prior to occupation of the development.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction.</p>

<p style="margin: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: black;">Within 3 months of occupation of the development hereby approved, the panels shall be installed and</span><span style="color: black;"><u>&nbsp;</u></span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">full details including installation certificates by MSC registered installer must be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority providing full details to demonstrate at least the following standards have been met, as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (prepared by Verte dated January 2024)</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><br></span><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 10pt; font-family: Symbol;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;</span></span><u style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"></u><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Solar PV panels capacity of 38.7 kWp&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Symbol;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;</span></span><u></u><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Solar PV panels array of 175.75 sqm</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><br></span></p><p style="margin: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The&nbsp;</span>details so approved shall be installed and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero and net zero carbon development and construction.</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a full air permeability test report confirming all units have achieved an air permeability of 8 m3/h/m2@50pa as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement (prepared by Verte dated January 2024) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction.</p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The approved scheme shall be delivered in accordance with the approved revised Energy Strategy (prepared by Verte, January 2024), demonstrating the following standards and key metrics have been achieved:&nbsp;</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-inline-start:48px;"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;" style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Minimum carbon savings of 42% Part L 2013 through fabric efficiency;&nbsp;</span></p></li></ul><ul style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-inline-start:48px;"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;" overall carbon savings of 74% against Part L 2013;&nbsp;</span></p></li></ul><ul style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-inline-start:48px;"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;" Heating demand of 11.72 kWh/sqm/yr using a predictive modelling calculation methodology;&nbsp;</span></p></li></ul><ul style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-inline-start:48px;"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;" aria-level="1"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;" role="presentation"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Energy Use Intensity of 86.88 kWh/sqm/yr using a predictive modelling calculation methodology.&nbsp;</span></p></li></ul><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2155da70-7fff-1605-ad4b-0ed979a08ac4"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable and net zero development and construction.</span></p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved the cycle and refuse storage facilities and shower/changing facilities shall be provided in full and retained in perpetuity thereafter.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of promoting sustainable transport.</p><div><br></div>

<p>The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until a Scheme of Highway Improvement Works to include removing the redundant crossover on Curtain Road has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall not be occupied until the scheme has been completed in full in accordance with the approved details. The works shall only be undertaken by the local highway authority [Transport for London] (or by a third party appointed by the local highway authority) and shall be undertaken at the expense of the developer.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety.</p><div><br></div>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
